intro: Saxifraga burseriana, commonly known as the Burser's saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions at high elevations. The plant features basal rosettes of leaves and produces small, white or pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in mountainous areas. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to cold and harsh environmental conditions.
